title: Calories in Lasagna
meta_description: Learn calories in lasagna per serving, with full nutrition breakdown including carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and tips for variations like vegetarian.
assumptions: Classic meat lasagna with ground beef, ricotta, mozzarella, pasta sheets; one serving â‰ˆ250 g or 1/8 of a 9x13-inch pan, baked.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredients, portion size, and preparation method. Check labels or recipes for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One serving of lasagna provides about 450 kcal and 25 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Low-fat (use skim cheese and lean beef)

faqs.q: How many calories in one serving of lasagna?
faqs.a: About 450 kcal for a 250 g serving of classic meat lasagna.

faqs.q: What are the macros in lasagna?
faqs.a: Per serving: 30 g carbs, 25 g protein, 22.5 g fat.
Yes, one serving has around 875 mg sodium from cheese and sauce.

faqs.q: How do calories change in vegetable lasagna?
faqs.a: Vegetarian lasagna is typically 50-100 kcal lower per serving due to no meat.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in lasagna?
faqs.a: One serving provides about 25 g protein from meat and cheeses.
